title: US trade deficit narrows to $54.0B in July, vs $53.4B expected
text: The U.S. trade deficit narrowed less than expected in July as the trade war between the United States and China drags on.

title: Market bull predicts the US and China will strike a trade deal before the presidential primaries
text: Oppenheimer's John Stoltzfus believes trade frictions between the U.S. and China will get resolved and pave the way to a significant market rally.

title: Stock futures higher as robust Chinese data eases growth worries
text: U.S. stock index futures rose on Wednesday after encouraging data from China allayed concerns of slowing global growth in the backdrop of an ongoing trade dispute between the United States and China.

title: The Fed Rethinks Its Role In A Recession
text: Fed Chair Powell has few levers to pull when it comes to staving off the next recession. The Fed is in a period dominated by low inflation, risks of financial excess, and a subsequent need to fundamentally rethink policy tools.

title: 5 things to know before the stock market opens Wednesday (Sep 04)
text: U.S. stock futures point to a strong open on Wall Street, a day after the Dow lost 285 points and broke a three-session winning streak.

title: The We Company to add academic Frances Frei to board after IPO after all-male board came under fire
text: The We Company  said Wednesday it expects to add Frances Frei to its board of directors once it has completed its initial public offering, making her the sole woman on its board. The parent of office space-sharing company WeWorks had come under fire when its initial IPO documents showed an all-male board.

title: WeWork adds woman to its board ahead of IPO after backlash
text: WeWork owner The We Company said on Wednesday it will add a woman to its board of directors and unwound a $5.9 million payment to its chief executive for use of the trademarked word "We" ahead of a planned initial public offering.

title: A Bitcoin ETF Arrives, Buy You've Got To Be A Pro To Use It
text: About 15 months after VanEck and SolidX revealed plans for the VanEck SolidX Bitcoin Trust ETF (XBTC), the bitcoin exchange traded fund dedicated to institutional investors will launch later this week, potentially paving the way for more cryptocurrency-related funds.

title: Wall Street has no idea where stocks will end 2019 with forecasts ranging from down 5% to up 11%
text: Stock forecasters are having a tougher time predicting where the S&P 500 will end up by year's end when compared to this time last year.

title: Huawei accuses US of cyber attacks as it prepares new phone launch
text: Huawei has accused US authorities of targeting the company with cyber attacks and attempting to coerce employees into giving up insider information.

title: Don’t Make Dumb Mistakes In The Search For Yield
text: If you want to lock in a yield of even 1.5% for a reasonable time period–the U. S. 2-year note is yielding only 1.45%–you will have to move outside the realm of sovereign debt.

title: I destressed in a futuristic techno spa before Berlin's big tech show
text: Commentary: Berlin's Liquidrom may seem like a dystopian vision straight out of a sci-fi movie, but it also proved the perfect venue to take a load off ahead of IFA.

title: Hard Rock International eyes bid for Greek tourist resort casino: paper
text: Hard Rock International will bid for a casino license in a long-delayed tourist development in Athens and plans to spend more than 1 billion euros ($1.11 billion) on the project, the U.S. firm's chairman said in a newspaper interview.

title: Stocks Gain On Hong Kong Hopes; Treasuries Decline: Markets Wrap
text: Stocks in Europe and Asia climbed along with American index futures on hopes for a return to calm in Hong Kong. Treasuries slipped with the dollar.

title: A Recession Isn’t Inevitable: The Case for Economic Optimism
text: The worrisome leading indicators are real, but so are the sources of resilience that could keep the expansion going.

title: Cathay Pacific says Chairman John Slosar resigns
text: Hong Kong's Cathay Pacific Airways  said on Wednesday that its Chairman John Slosar had resigned from the board and will be replaced by Patrick Healy, a long-time executive at the airline's top shareholder Swire Pacific Ltd.

title: Easing political worries in Europe lift shares, pound jumps
text: Easing worries over political risk in Britain and Italy helped stocks rise on Wednesday with the pound bouncing from three-year lows after a parliamentary vote raised the prospect of another delay to Brexit.

title: Global Negative Interest Rates: What Can Go Wrong and What Should Investors Do?
text: Written by: Donald A. Steinbrugge, CFA | Agecroft Partners Globally coordinated monetary stimulus prevented a potential economic meltdown in 2008 and helped create a quick rebound in the capital markets.

title: What Is a Fair Price to Pay for Stocks?
text:
Equity and fixed income markets have been on a wild ride in recent weeks, as recession fears, geopolitical uncertainty, and continued weakness in manufacturing have weighed on investor sentiment. title: Oil prices recover some ground, but economic concerns weigh
text: Oil prices recovered some ground on Wednesday after touching their lowest in close to a month during the previous session on concerns that a weakening global economy could depress demand.
